title: Bibliometric indices as a measure of performance and competitive balance in the knockout stage of the UEFA Champions League. (arXiv:2005.13416v3 [stat.AP] UPDATED)
abstract: We argue for the application of bibliometric indices to quantify the long-term uncertainty of outcome in sports. The Euclidean index is proposed to reward quality over quantity, while the rectangle index can be an appropriate measure of core performance. Their differences are highlighted through an axiomatic analysis and several examples. Our approach also requires a weighting scheme to compare different achievements. The methodology is illustrated by studying the knockout stage of the UEFA Champions League in the 20 seasons played between 2003 and 2023: club and country performances as well as three types of competitive balance are considered. Measuring competition at the level of national associations is a novelty. All results are remarkably robust concerning the bibliometric index and the assigned weights. translated_title: UEFA冠军联赛淘汰赛阶段的绩效和竞争均衡的计量指标
translated_abstract: 我们提出应用计量指标来量化体育比赛中长期不确定性。我们提出欧几里得指数来奖励质量而非数量，而矩形指数可以作为核心表现的适当度量。通过公理分析和几个例子，我们突出了它们的差异。我们的方法还需要一种加权方案来比较不同的成就。通过对2003年至2023年间进行的20个赛季的UEFA冠军联赛淘汰赛阶段的研究来说明方法：考虑俱乐部和国家的表现以及三种竞争均衡类型。在国家协会的水平上测量竞争是一种新颖的方法。所有结果对于计量指标和分配的权重非常稳健。由于国家协会的表现比个体俱乐部的结果更稳定，最好在UEFA冠军联赛小组赛中进行种子排序。
tldr: 本论文提出了应用计量指标来量化体育比赛中长期不确定性的方法，并通过研究UEFA冠军联赛淘汰赛阶段的俱乐部和国家表现，以及三种竞争均衡类型来验证该方法的有效性。
